page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN CHILMARK
page.content: {Employment}in Chilmark and Teffont is mostly concerned with{farming}although numbers employed on the land continue to fall. The{pub,}the{garage}and the {casting factory}provide some jobs.Self employed include a wine merchant and caterer,an agricultural journalist,a maker of thatching spars,an undertaker a rebuilder of classic cars as well as a signwriter, a builder and a painter and decorator. Outside the village employment is limited by poor public transport. {Tisbury}and{Salisbury}provide some jobs in factories and service industries. At least five members of the Armed Forces,some solicitors and accountants travel great distances by private car to their work. Several people work in{London,}and travel the hundred miles by train from{Tisbury. ANNE McGRAIL
